items.sentence: According to the paper, it will snow tomorrow.
This clock must\'ve belonged to Tom\'s father.
Tom packed a lunch for Mary to take to school.
If Tom calls, tell him I\'ll be there by 2:30.
I expect to be paid for this work by tomorrow.
I forgot to tell you how much you need to pay.
Tom\'s remarks touched off a violent argument.
Tom doesn\'t have enough money to buy a house.
Tom doesn\'t have to get up so early tomorrow.
Tom pulled out his knife and peeled the apple.
Tom and Mary weren\'t able to help me do that.
I have to hand in my report by next Wednesday.
Tom opened his desk drawer and took out a pen.
Why isn\'t there any food in the refrigerator?
Would you like to have dinner with us tonight?
Do you want to go grab a hot dog or something?
Does Tom still come to Boston every Christmas?
Tom\'s apartment is infested with cockroaches.
No one bought anything Tom was trying to sell.
No one knows exactly when we need to be there.
I soon learned Tom was hard to get along with.
Tom came by to visit late yesterday afternoon.
I can\'t believe you gave Tom that much money.
I can\'t decide which route to take to Boston.
I can\'t do all of this without a little help.
Do you know what happened here this afternoon?
I know a guy who plays the guitar fairly well.
Tom has given me three tickets to his concert.
I was staring at Tom and he was staring at me.
Tom hasn\'t yet told Mary about what happened.
It\'s hard to know exactly what to believe in.
It\'s hard to tell if a woman is really happy.
It\'s not as cold here as I expected it to be.
Tom prefers the acoustic version of this song.
Tom ran into the bedroom and slammed the door.
I wonder if there\'s something wrong with Tom.
Did you do what you\'ve been accused of doing?
Why do you care so much about what Tom thinks?
You\'re the person who best fits the position.
I\'m planning to drive to Boston next weekend.
What chance does Tom have of actually winning?
There\'s a chance that I can be there by 2:30.
This is my first time to go anywhere by plane.
This is probably not a good time to visit Tom.
Do you know how much Tom gets paid to do that?
Tom realizes Mary doesn\'t like him very much.
Tom has been in the hospital for a few months.
Tom has contributed a lot of money to charity.
Tom has little chance of winning the election.
Don\'t you have someplace else you need to be?
